scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
dah, max, colonels, flex, al, ty, jed, awoke, ize, i, bil, pling, i, fierce, re, scat, tered, i, ly, swathes, crip, ma, cues

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — the greatest possible degree
B. (1 syllables) — a commissioned military officer in the United States Army or Air Force or Marines who ranks above a lieutenant colonel and below a brigadier general
C. (1 syllables) — stop sleeping
D. (1 syllables) — sports implement consisting of a tapering rod used to strike a cue ball in pool or billiards
E. (2 syllables) — in an emotionally fierce manner
F. (3 syllables) — expand or complete (a part in a piece of baroque music) by supplying the harmonies indicated in the figured bass
G. (2 syllables) — That cripples or incapacitates
H. (5 syllables) — The quality of being flexible, whether physically or metaphorically.
I. (2 syllables) — port city in western Saudi Arabia on the Red Sea; near Mecca
J. (2 syllables) — move away from each other

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

## Clues

B. (3 syllables) — DOM: coordinated body movement
C. (2 syllables) — to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means :
D. (2 syllables) — DOM: mineral
E. (3 syllables) — DOM: adult worker
F. (3 syllables) — DOM: chemical reaction
G. (3 syllables) — DOM: laceration
H. (4 syllables) — establish the validity of something, as by an example, explanation or experiment
I. (1 syllables) — cultivate by growing, often involving improvements by means of agricultural techniques
J. (2 syllables) — DOM: , the main ingredient....

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 12 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
